definition: lit. to occupy a latrine but not shit (proverb)/fig. to be a dog in the manger
pinyin: zhan4 zhe5 mao2 keng1 bu4 la1 shi3

sentences.english: But soon the ox came back from his work to the manger.
sentences.chinese: 但是很快的牛回来，从他的作品占着茅坑不拉屎。

sentences.english: John is a dog in the manger.
sentences.chinese: 约翰是个占着茅坑不拉屎的人。

sentences.english: No child wants to play with a dog in the manger.
sentences.chinese: 有哪个孩子想和占着茅坑不拉屎的人一起玩。

sentences.english: You are really a dog in the manger.
sentences.chinese: 你真是个站着茅坑不拉屎的人啊。

sentences.english: Now go close to the latrine and put your face there.
sentences.chinese: 现在走到茅坑那里把你的脸放在里面。

sentences.english: There are some officials who are only the dogs in the manger.
sentences.chinese: 有些官员只是占着茅坑不拉屎。

sentences.english: In the rainy season, the pit overflows all over the school grounds.
sentences.chinese: 在雨季，茅坑出来的水溢满整个学校的地面。

sentences.english: I am as a dog in the manger.
sentences.chinese: 你真是个站着茅坑不拉屎的人啊。

sentences.english: He who eats too many prunes, sits on potty many moons.
sentences.chinese: 李子多吃最伤人，害你茅坑月月蹲。

sentences.english: There were no proper toilets, but only an outdoor latrine .
sentences.chinese: 没有正规的厕所，只有一个位于室外的茅坑。

definition: human excrement/night soil (human manure traditionally used as agricultural fertilizer)
variant of 茅廁|茅厕[mao2 si5]
to pass water/to piss/to urinate/to wee wee
to defecate (euphemism)/to go to the toilet
